titleStmt.title: Letter from Esse T. Emmert to John G. Neihardt
titleStmt.author: Emmert, Esse T.

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Esse T. Emmert to John G. Neihardt

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

opener.salute: Dear John: It is always good to hear the many nice things about you which members of my family in Nebraska tell me.

div1.p: Your work has brought you many rewards you richly deserve. How wonderful to have your daughters so near you!
I appreciated very much the letter you wrote and especially what you said about my mother. She dearly loved your family. Your oldest sister was my first teacher in school.
Few years ago we moved to this place in Idaho from Glacier Park. My husband retired then from the National Park Service, we have lived in all the western Parks.
Our house as pictured here on the other side has been torn down but memories of our happy family remain. We have one son and two grandchildren who live in Memphis.

closer.salute: Best wishes and loving thoughts from your old friend

figure.ab: The Teich Family Home Bancroft, Nebraska
